name: io.bytes.per.checksum
description:
The number of bytes per checksum.  Must not be larger than
  io.file.buffer.size.

name: dfs.datanode.socket.reuse.keepalive
description:
The window of time in ms before the DataXceiver closes a socket for a
    single request.  If a second request occurs within that window, the
    socket can be reused.

name: dfs.client.refresh.read-block-locations.threads
description:
Number of threads to use for refreshing LocatedBlocks of registered
      DFSInputStreams. If a DFSClient opens many DFSInputStreams, increasing
      this may help refresh them all in a timely manner.

name: dfs.stream-buffer-size
description:
The size of buffer to stream files.
  The size of this buffer should probably be a multiple of hardware
  page size (4096 on Intel x86), and it determines how much data is
  buffered during read and write operations.

name: mapreduce.job.ubertask.maxmaps
description:
Threshold for number of maps, beyond which job is considered
  too big for the ubertasking optimization.  Users may override this value,
  but only downward.

name: mapreduce.job.end-notification.retry.attempts
description:
The number of times the submitter of the job wants to retry job
    end notification if it fails. This is capped by
    mapreduce.job.end-notification.max.attempts

name: mapreduce.am.max-attempts
description:
The maximum number of application attempts. It is a
  application-specific setting. It should not be larger than the global number
  set by resourcemanager. Otherwise, it will be override. The default number is
  set to 2, to allow at least one retry for AM.
